title: Billion-dollar natural disasters: Natural catastrophes in 2020 ‘create global economic loss of $210bn’
lead: A new study shows six-in-ten of the costliest natural catastrophes during 2020 occurred in the US

title: ‘Nearly 48% of banking customers would cash out if they knew their bank was funding fossil fuels’
lead: Seven-in-ten customers would choose a bank with a positive social and environmental impacts, according to a new report

title: South Korean SK Group invests $1.5bn in US hydrogen fuel cell manufacturer Plug Power
lead: SK Group will take a 9.9% stake in Plug Power and together they will form a joint venture to promote hydrogen fuel cell products in Asian markets

title: Ecotricity seals 10-year agreement to take geothermal power from Cornish plant
lead: The PPA will see a minimum of 3MW of baseload electricity power the equivalent of 10,000 homes every year

title: Coventry and Oxford on track to become ‘UK’s first’ all-electric bus cities
lead: The cities could be awarded up to £50 million each to introduce all-electric bus services as a result of an England-wide competition

title: Trump administration’s Arctic drilling auction ‘secures lower bidding interest than expected’
lead: Several environmental organisations opposed oil and gas drilling on the Arctic Refuge as it would threaten wildlife and worsen climate change

title: British Gas engineers start five-day strike over pay and conditions
lead: GMB union said it is the ‘first national gas strike in a decade’

title: Smarter Grid Solutions appointed to project to help free up grid capacity for clean power
lead: The firm has been appointed Active Network Management partner for the innovative QUEST project, which is expected to save networks more than £250m

title: Fossil fuel divestment could be shifting finance into ‘pollution havens’
lead: The University of Edinburgh Business School warns that some domestic banks in countries with strict environmental policies are simply shifting their fossil fuel spending abroad

title: UK summer heatwaves projected to soar 50% higher than global average
lead: A new study warns the country could face a ‘future of extreme heatwaves’, carrying with it a raft of serious health risks
